title: Thunderbird password
content:
How to get back to inputting my password when I log in and at the first email sent?

I like inputting my password every time I log in and also had set it for inputting my password for the first message I was sending for privacy and security reasons.

Recently Thunderbird stopped asking me for a password. The saved passwords are nothing like the password I had been using. So, I am confused. Where do they come from? What happened that Thunderbird is not asking me for a password any longer. Had that something to do with an update? I don't dare to remove those saved passwords for fear they are important and I won't be able to use Thunderbird.
creator: chrisjae

title: Cannot set Thunderbird default browser to Firefox
content:
Kubuntu 22.04 Thunderbird 102.7.1 (64-bit)

I simply cannot change the default browser from Chrome to Firefox.

  • Firefox is my default browser.
  • I've set network.protocol-handler.warn-external.http and network.protocol-handler.warn-external.https to true.
  • I've edited the attachment entries for https and http to "always ask"
  • I've delete the attachment entries for https and http

No success. Thunberbird always reverts the setting to Chrome.

This should not be so complicated :( Why not a simple setting "Default browers" and pick one from there?
creator: mail411

title: Messages to a gmail address are blocked
content:
Recently most but not all messages I send to my wife's gmail address fail - the Message Delivery Failure notice contains the text below. I have done some research on "SPF" and "DKIM", so I know what the abbreviations stand for and something about their use. But I can't determine how either one might be implemented in T-bird to solve the problem. Both seem to be closely linked to the gmail ecosystem. I do not use gmail on T-Bird; all of my accounts are for/with my own .name domain name. This arrangement has worked very well for years, until this gmail issue started. Can anyone shed any light on it?

Thanks in advance for any help or words of wisdom.

Reason: There was an error while attempting to deliver your message with [Subject: "Text of LLC question"] to XXXXXXXXX@gmail.com. MTA p3plwbeout15-05.prod.phx3.secureserver.net received this response from the destination host IP - 172.253.122.27 - 550 , 550-5.7.26 This message does not pass authentication checks (SPF and DKIM both 550-5.7.26 do not pass). SPF check for [dunbar7.name] does not pass with ip: 550-5.7.26 [173.201.193.42].To best protect our users from spam, the message 550-5.7.26 has been blocked. Please visit 550-5.7.26 https://support.google.com/mail/answer/81126#authentication for more 550 5.7.26 information. 8-20020a370b08000000b0071f40a59fedsi3647616qkl.653 - gsmtp
creator: tech23

title: Message Tags Problem
content: Two email accounts, one a havenstreets.org domain and one a comcast.net domain. The havenstreets.org has a filter to tag incoming emails green. The comcast.net is filtered to tag incoming emails magenta. The havenstreets.org domain tags fine. The comcast.net domain tags as both havenstreets.org and comcast.net. This has been happening for about 3 versions up to 102.8.0. I have checked my filters for errors and I have deleted the filters and created new ones yet the problem remains. Thew screenshot I have attached shows exactly what I am talking about. The email is from Grubhub to the comcast.net email address Any ideas?
creator: outreachservices

title: Moving Thunderbird Local Folders to Gmail
content:
I have thousands of emails I've moved from Entourage into Thunderbird (mbox folders). They work fine in Thunderbird.

Now I'd like to move them to a Gmail account I've enabled via IMAP in Thunderbird. Moving them manually—either en mass, folder by folder; or individually—to Thunderbird's Gmail folder (label) does nothing; they don't show up in Gmail (either in Thunderbird or using Gmail's web interface).

Any suggestions?

Thanks.
creator: Meyerson

title: TB forgets archive folder setting
content:
I keep a separate IMAP account to store my email archives, and on my primary account I have set the Archives setting to `"Archives" Folder on: the other account`. But for some reason, in certain cases the Archive operation moves the selected email(s) to the Archives folder on my main account.

I couldn't really figure out what it depends on. Initially it appeared that maybe whether the UI focus is on the message list pane or the preview? But I tried selecting two emails in the message list pane and archiving them, which moved them to the correct account/folder. But when I moved those back to the main inbox, and selected them together with a specific third email, then all three got moved within the main account.

This gets really annoying.
creator: mortee

title: TB keeps redownloading my 20+k AOL mails over IMAP
content:
Hey!

I am having some trouble with my aol mail account.

Some weeks ago, I noticed that only the last 10k mails were loaded and that the server `imap.aol.com` has this limit built-in, so another thread said I should switch to `export.imap.aol.com`. I did this and now all 20+k mails get loaded, though awfully slow, like 1 or 2 seconds per mail. That wouldn't be that much of a problem if it were a one-time thing. However, in the last few weeks, TB restarted the download process from scratch without an obvious reason at least two times. Today, this happened again and I can give some more info.

At 15:20, I started TB. At 20:32, the Activity Manager said: "Deleted 22825k messages from Inbox". At 20:40, it said "<mymail>@aol.de is up to date. Total number of messages downloaded: 1" At 22:01, it said "Indexed 142 messages in Inbox" (though not, in which one, I got several mail addresses in TB) And now (I don't know since when) it says "Bringing folder Inbox uo to date... Downloading message 964 of 22826 in Inbox..." The interesting thing is that this number is less than what I remember I saw last time and I still see in the status bar that says "Total: 24580"

Is this a known problem?

I appreciated any help.
creator: ricebe

title: Want consistent font size display in both compose and receive windows (whether single lg. window or in GUI)
content:
Someday perhaps font view/controls will be revisited with settings that behave sensibly, and understandable by mere mortals. I've used T-bird in excess of a decade and ike many of its feature not found elsewhere. Someday I hope that its core email client features can become as stable as many of the more commercial email clients (I'd definitely pay much more than a donation for such stability in release versions.)

Meanwhile, the problem: I want T-bird's compose and received email views—whether in the main GUI window or a separate window—to look as close as possible to what recipients see in most other email clients see (notably Outlook as the standard).

Check out my enclosed files: 1.ThunderbirdComposeWindow.png 2.Settings-General-LangAppear-FontsColors-Advanced-FontsEncoding.png 3.Settings-HTMLStyle.png 4.Received-On-Outlook.png 5.Received-On-Thunderbird.png 6.signatureHtml.png [enclosed for reference]

If the desired outcome involves editing .css (or other files) or editing config settings, that's ok. If so, please give the path to the file(s) and some reasonably explicit parameter editing instructions (I am not a css programmer).

Very much appreciated (I really don't want to move to Outlook or another email client.)
creator: jeffb4

I don't understand why it would remove access to my folders when I use them all to sort my mail. I have about 30 other folders I use and now it's only showing the one and one of its multiple subfolders. I am just lost and would like to have my folders back.

title: Combining emails from the SAME accounts from different install profiles over time!
content:
A long time ago, say C2004 I had a thunderbird install on my old K6, but I lost access to the computer, and it took ages before I had the datafiles... but I do. Meanwhile I migrated to a i7 1st Gen Lappy, and made a clean install of TB and started my email collection all over again...

About five years ago, I stopped using the laptop and I stored the HDD... meanwhile I went back to a desktop and this was a i5-4thGen, with YOU GUESSED IT.... a brand new install of TB and a whole new collection of emails in a separate profile...

Now... this HDD died... but through SHEER DUMB LUCK, it died DURING a back up of the drive... what was the dumb luck... the drive it was backing up to was considerably larger, and the death occurred in the zone between the partitions... having stretched the original backup of the old c_drive I didn't lose any of the d_drive 2nd partition.... ANYWAY... just pure dumb luck... I have a complete profile... so on my new i5-4670, I've imported the previous profile... but I've still not found out HOW TO merge my old inboxes of the same email addresses from the previous datasets.

Can anyone help me please?
creator: bastin_mp
